You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
INDUSTRIES COMMON FEATURES GUIDE
Data Processing Engine

Data Processing Engine helps you transform data that's available in your Salesforce org and write back the transformation results as new or updated records. You can transform the data for standard and custom objects, and Analytics datasets using Data Processing Engine definitions.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Professional Editions with Financial Services Cloud, Manufacturing Cloud, Loyalty Management, Net Zero Cloud, Rebate Management, Accounting Subledger, or Provider Search in Health Cloud

Watch the video to see how Data Processing Engine works and how you can use DPE to transform data:

If you aren’t able to watch the video in full screen, open the video in a new tab:https://salesforce.vidyard.com/watch/rZzBj9BD6SoW4pM5pnbNeF

After you activate a Data Processing Engine definition, you can use a flow to run it. And you can track each run by using Monitor Workflow Services.

Enable Data Pipelines
To create and run Data Processing Engine definitions, enable Data Pipelines. With Data Pipelines you can query and compute data that's available in your Salesforce org.
Permissions to Work with Data Processing Engine
Your Salesforce org and users require permissions and access to create, activate, and run Data Processing Engine definitions.
Data Processing Engine Builder
Get to know the Data Processing Engine Builder before you work with it.
Data Processing Engine Runtimes
To efficiently handle industry cloud data, Data Processing Engine supports two off-core runtimes: CRM Analytics and Data Cloud.
Data Processing Engine Workflow
Let’s look at the steps an admin completes to set up and run a Data Processing Engine definition.
Data Processing Engine Nodes
Each node type in the Data Processing Engine lets you transform your data in a different way. Examples include joining two datasets, calculating a field value using formulas, and appending a dataset to another dataset.
Define Input Variables
Input variables allow you to define a default value that can be used in Filter and Formula nodes. Define input variables and use them in filter and formula nodes.
Create a Data Processing Engine Definition
You can create multiple Data Processing Engine definitions based on your business requirements.
Run Data Processing Engine Definitions
You can run a Data Processing Engine definition using Flows or from the definition's builder. Use Flows when you want to run a definition on a particular schedule or when the definition is part of another business process. Run a definition from the builder when you want the run to process specific input variable values so that you can test and validate the writeback results.
Monitor Your Data Processing Engine Definition Runs
Monitor definition runs to see if the runs succeed or fail. In Monitor Workflow Services, you can view the status of a Data Processing Engine definition's run and its individual tasks. In the Data Manager of Data Pipelines, monitor the data sync and the recipe for the run.
Track Your Data Processing Engine Usage
Data Processing Engine definition runs can process and write back data up to a specific size. If your Salesforce org reaches a daily or monthly limit, the definitions stop running.
Share Data Processing Engine Definitions
You can create a Data Processing Engine definition and share it with other Salesforce orgs using managed and unmanaged packages and change sets. Partners and independent software vendors (ISV) can create and share definitions with their customers.
Delete a Data Processing Engine Definition
Delete inactive Data Processing Engine definitions that you aren’t using. Before you delete a definition, make sure that it’s not referenced in any flow.
Data Processing Engine Best Practices
Before you create and run a Data Processing Engine definition, understand the best practices.
Data Processing Engine Limits
While creating and running Data Processing Engine definitions, keep the limits and limitations in mind.
Troubleshoot Data Processing Engine Issues
Can’t seem to get Data Processing Engine working for you? To resolve issues with Data Processing Engine, try these solutions.
Data Processing Engine Developer Resources
You can create, activate, and run Data Processing Engine definitions using developer resources.
Provide Purchase Credit to Accounts and Reward Salespeople Based on Orders (Example)
Cloud Kicks provides a 5% year-end purchase credit to accounts based on their total effective orders that ended between January 1 and November 30. The salespeople associated with these orders are also rewarded with 0.5% of the total order amount as a bonus. The purchase credit and bonus are granted to the accounts and salespeople on December 1 each year.

Calculate Component Forecasts with Data Processing Engine Templates for Program Based Business

title: Configuring and Using Salesforce Data Processing Engine
